title: Trying to deobfuscate multi layered javascript [closed]
content:
Closed. This question is off-topic. It is not currently accepting answers.
                                
                            











 Questions asking for help reverse-engineering a specific system are off-topic unless they demonstrate an understanding of the concepts involved and clearly identify a specific problem.


Closed 10 years ago.







                        Improve this question
                    



Can someone deobfuscate this code? I am not getting any way to deobfuscate  this.
Unable to paste it over here as it over passed 30,000 word limit.
http://pastebin.com/V327Q8Hg
Thanks

answers_data.content:
Mostly cleaned up, you can rename vars if you will.
pastebin

comments.text: Hey how did you do this? I still see some hex values, possible to remove that and get the exact value?

these are not hex values, these are variable names, i didnt bother renaming stuff manually. Not sure if the script can still be run either. didnt try. I used beautify on it and wrote a python script to replace variables which you can see at the top, i.e. the contents of var _0xe473
can you tell me which method you used? when I used jsbeautifier.org it gives some other values in 1st line which is there in your fix.
add a tickbox for unescape printable chars, should do the trick.
